38942492.review:
I enjoyed the first Doom & Destiny and would recommend it, but, ugh, I really, really, really HATE the interface for this one. It annoys me that I can't save anywhere I want like I could in the first D&D. I often don't have the luxury of time, so needing to find a crystal to save my game before I shutdown is a major deterrent. I also dislike that I can no longer manage my gear.


I have no idea if the story is enjoyable. I suspect it probably is. I simply can't get past the game mechanics. Like, to the point that I requested a refund.

29279174.review:
Story:
I thought the story was a bit weaker than the previous one but that could be because it took a while for the fun, wacky stuff to happen. But the story was more about dimensions overlapping and stuff than parody set pieces this time which was okay and I enjoyed the locations and characters, though I hop you do more with them as I find them pretty interesting, like explore Viola and her getting use to technology or Esmeralda's crush on Francis. I know you gonna do something with the Emporer later.

I do have two big things that bother me. One was the opening. I was so confused about what was happening and who Esmeralda was and what was with Hulk Hogan and Randy Savage. It bothered me personaly. Another issue I had was the villain. I didn't find him that fun or interesting. The villain from the last game was just clever in every way and made the world make so much sense. Solomon Steel was just.. I don't know. I just didn't like him.

I would say I liked the ending in this one way more than the last game. How they escaped was pretty clever and I like those kinds of endings.

Gameplay: 
Same but different is the best way to describe it. I was a bit put off by the lack of invortory and that everything relied on money, food, mana and stuff. But after awhile and experimenting with some items and classes, I think it works. Like it encouages you to spend them but make sure you have enough.

And I also liked the classes I've played so far, with the only exception being the Necromancer. While some we're the same to me only with a few buffs like a counter or increase damge, I put the effort in trying to upgrade them every chance I get. I even liked using the chef for his ability weaken enemies and make them bleed. 

And finally: OH MY GOD, Death is a freaken truck!

Presentation:
I'm a sucker for the cute, happy look everyone has and I like the monster deisgns, espiaclly those cute underground squares. The music was okay with my favorite being the one for Limbo or the world map but my least favorite track is the boss music. But I got use to it. It's not god awful.
touch
And I really like that you used the same world map but mildly changed it to fit the story and locations was a nice touch. I think we have a good framing for this series.Even though you said(SPOILERS!!)

I know this game is unfinished with most of the  side stuff not done yet but once again, I want to explore this world.

Also more pigeon mail.

29019694.review:
The sheer numbers being tossed around by random mobs is insane. I regularly lose a character in combat because he will finish off an enemy and then three enemies all target him back-to-back killing him. 

Don't bother spending resources to heal your party; You're far better off just dying and respawning since you lose nothing when you do.

Every single battle is a slog that drains more resources than it should.

Throughout the game there are treasures and areas you can't access unless you trudge back to a respawn point and swap out your classes and then trudge back.

I loved the first Doom & Destiny but gave up during the fight with Death in this one (in chapter 3). Death did a cold attack that slowed my party and then had so many turns so quickly that he just killed everyone far too quickly for me to do anything about it. 

Alt-F4. Won't play this again.

28912784.review:
There's a lot to like about this game, but I ended up having to quit in frustration due to a huge design flaw that undermines everything else going on. There are no save slots and no ability to manually make a save or go back to a previous point in the game. You respawn at a crystal if you die, but the game remembers everything that happened. Which is already bad, but there's places in the game where you're locked in to plot battles with no way out, so if you find yourself in a situation where you can't win the fight (yes, the game is very hard and has no difficulty options, so don't think this won't happen to you), then the situation can become unwinnable. This happened to me in chapter 12, and I won't be finishing the game as a result after getting very close to the end. Utterly frustrating.

Leave the autosave mechanic to roguelikes and Dark Souls. It has no place in normal RPG's.

Doom and Destiny Advanced

Pros: Solid Rpg with innovation.

Aunque para esta fecha que publique este analisis el juego sigue en desarrollo la historia principal ya esta terminada, en resumen el juego me parecio muy bueno superando al anterior (en ciertos aspectos pero puede mejorarlos), desde que conoci su primera entrega en movil (Nokia Lumia 610), me adentro al mundo de los RPG tradicionales por turnos, cuando me entere que sacarian la secuela quise irme por experimentarla mejor en PC, no conoci lo que es jugar un juego en desarrollo hasta que que lo compre, aun recuerdo que lo compre una semana despues de su salida, ya que su premera semana no ahorre, no me cansaba de reiniciar la historia por cada actualizacion que sacaban para encontrar cuantas cosas nuevas agregaban, puedo aclarar que me la pase muy bien jugandolo y espero verlo mejor con mas libertad de exploración como el primero.
Pos data: Tengo un registro de 161.8 horas jugadas hasta la fecha de esta publicacion.
Pos data para el equipo de este juego: Sigan asi, no hay muchos juegos RPG tradicionales para estas fechas que convencen (pero no se pasen en tratar de explotar mas juegos de esta franquicia).

23989674.review:
스토리의 참신함은 조금 있지만 기본적인 플롯은 주인공들이 세계를 돌아다니면서 성장해서 악당을 때려눕히는 전형적인 JRPG이다.
전작은 기존의 JRPG 방식의 시스템에서 조금 벗어났지만 이번작은 굉장히 다른 시스템들을 도입하여 신선했다.
소비형 아이템을 없애고 Reagent(시약), Stuff(재료), Food(음식) 등을 도입하여 아이템을 대체하였다.
그떄 그떄 필요한 것들을 자원을 통해 만들 수 있어서 플레이가 더 유연해졌다.
캐릭터 마다 다양한 클래스들이 있어서 클래스들을 찾아다니는 재미도 있다. 

무엇보다 이런 게임의 가장 재밌는 부분은 제작자가 숨겨둔 비밀들을 찾아다니는 것이다. 스토리만 따라가지 않고 다양한 것들을 찾아다니다 보면 모험의 즐거움을 느낄 수 있다.

23635248.review:
The first Doom and Destiny was an unexpected strike of liquid gold. Despite its generic RPG Maker graphics and sometimes poor translation, it came out swinging as one of the best turn based RPGs since the SNES era. The sequel, however, leaves much to be desired. This review is while the game is still unfinished, but there are some glaring issues not related to bugs, balance, or the unfinished story.

PROS: 
- Custom graphics that while cartoony, fit the tone of the game quite well.
- Class system has the potential to be interesting, especially when used to find secrets and navigate terrain.
- Clever introduction to a story: the game functions as a parallel universe to the original story, which has the potential to make a very interesting tale.

CONS:
- The characters fall flat to the original. This is a big problem, as the charm of the dialog was what made the first game so damn good. Toilet humor rules the day in this sequel, and the characters just don't have much in the way of banter, 4th wall breaking, or personality. I played the whole time waiting for Mike to say or do something really zany, but it just never happened.
- The story quickly goes nowhere. Interesting ideas like the frog king trying to marry the characters off to his daughters is quickly brushed aside into a boss battle. Instead this game just seems to have a very generic RPG story with a few eccentric ideas used in the background.
- The class system feels too constrictive. You basically have to dump all your resources to get a decent level for one class per character, leaving the other classes woefully underpowered. This kind of class system would be really good if you could switch between them more liberally and usefully.
- Equipment management is gone. Characters now auto-equip items and there’s no ability to customize your characters in this regard. This is a huge disappointment, as managing equipment is a big part of any RPG, and leaves the full burden of customization to the class system, which is poorly executed.

Overall I’d say this game needs a lot of work to be anywhere near as enjoyable as the first game. As-is, I stopped playing after a dozen or so hours, not because I reached the end of the content available at the time, but simply because I was getting bored. For now, this sequel is simply a disappointment.

The graphics are on point, the story from my view is enjoyable and the humour is hilariously funny with tons of relatable references. The combat system + leveling system is really in depth. I like the fact the developers added classes for characters it reminds me of the FFX-II class system. The other thing I enjoyed when playing this game is I constantly feel like I'm playing dungeons and dragons the game really gives off that vibe even though it has jrpg style combat. If I were to reccomend improving anything so far it would just be to maybe make the game a little tougher so that the enemies take longer to kill. I think at the present it is a little too easy and making the enemies a little tougher would make the game time longer to. I say that because I don't want the game to end I just wanna keep playing though haha.

18667295.review:
Bought game on sale (about 7 euros) and played for about 2 hours. I initially bought the game because i really liked the first Do&De (have free version on android) and wanted to buy a copy of it, but 2 friends of mine told it was better not to (one had problems on android and the other on pc), so i at least bought this one, to "make up" for the missed purchase on the first.
After 2 hours my first thoughts are:
Cons:
-different graphics are kinda weird, but no biggy
-english translation isn't that good, but passable
-first kinda sad poop joke (not a fan of "potty humor)
-different levelling system (not necessarily bad, just different and more "complex") (note: i've not read anything about this game, so i don't know ny existing builds or max-level or anything, i bought it because i wanted to support the team)
Pros:
-i love flashbacks, having one at the beginning of the game was wonderful
-same character can play more than one class (awesome)
-funny jokes
-story gets you curious 
-HP and MP recharge a small amount after every battle (yay)
-one unique "currency" for objects (ex: they are now "food" and "alchemy stuff" instead of "sandwich, pizza, chips, etc" and "beer, wine, coke, etc")

All in all I would recommend this game: it's still in early access, but i expect great things from the team, and they deserve a reward of some sort...at least it's cash and not some rusty sword they'd throw away anyways.
In time I might modify this review and update it with new thoughts as i play through the game, hopefully with happy and good results.

18246480.review:
On prend les mêmes (ou pas) et on recommence !

Pour avoir joué au premier (la version gratos, et d'ailleurs il mérite d'être acheté), j'en attendais énormément et après avoir vu les premiers screen, j'avais un peu peur. Le style graphique changeant (plus éloigné de RPG Maker et les têtes des héros), le système de job (comparé à un système de points de magie à dépenser pour se les équiper), le plot en lui-même (un business man qui veut dominer le multivers, avant on devait vaincre le grand méchant (du pure caricaturale, faut l'préciser)), ainsi que les musiques (Oui bon, c'est le pack de base de Rpg maker, mais il était très bien utilisé).

Bah mon con, je me suis bien planté.

Un monument du RPG. Un RPG qui fout une baffe à n'importe quel RPG actuel. Le système de job est en l'état une idée excellente, une nostalgie envers les FF, bien que par moment frustrant, puisque que chacun des jobs (?) possèdent un pouvoir passif utilisables sur la map (sacrifice de poulet, cuisine dans une marmite, parler aux fantômes) et que pour changer de job, il faut impérativement passer par un cristal, ce qui est vite agaçant dans les débuts de jeu quand t'es obligé de passer ton Cleric en knight, surtout qu'on doit faire évoluer ses jobs, non pas avec un système d'exp (qui concerne le perso dans sa globalité) mais avec des "nuggets" et des "shards", utilisables au cristal. D'ailleurs les caractéristiques prédominantes de chaque job vous permettent de savoir quels sont les caractéristiques à booster en priorité (+2 de carac' en bonus après un level up). Même si les persos ont déjà des caractéristiques prédéfinis de bases (faut se référer aux couleurs), ils peuvent s'adapter sur tout rôle. N'importe lequel d'entre eux peut être heal, soutien, guerrier, tank. Et chaque techniques/attaques est l'occasion de voir une phrase débile en combat : "La vie de héros coûte cher, tu sais ?"(Avec le passif de rogue de Francis), l'obsession de Mike pour le "Monstre Spaghetti" etc.

Cela amène parfois les héros à sortir des clichés et références à tout et n'importe quoi, même les cosplay des différents jobs n'y échappent pas : Le Fighter avec un skin de Kratos, le Rogue qui a un skin de banquier. Le sage Schtroumpf qu'on retrouve dans les marées. On va retrouver la Mort mangeant une pizza (Un p'tit côté "Le Disque-Monde").

Le jeu a une difficulté très bien dosé, ni trop dur, ni trop facile, bourré de side-quest et de secret vraiment bien foutus et dissimulés (bien que parfois le grind est obligatoire pour les side-quest, notamment si l'on veut le fighter et les trésors de certains rois/reines. Et aussi que le gold peut vite se gagner dans les arènes, notamment celles de l'Empereur). Le trip cliché du geek qui se retrouve plongé dans un autre monde fonctionne à merveille, avec des situations ridicules : les gars qui ne s'embarrassent pas de formalités ou d'autres qui se la jouent RP et qui se foirent lamentablement, sans compter les taunts que se prend Francis sur son premier job (Cuistot, alors que dans leurs jeux RP il incarne un voleur).

L'OST est correct. Sans plus, dans certaines zones les musiques sont bien utilisés, on est dans l'ambiance, mais à contrario à certains moments, les combats de boss notamment, on a pas d'impressions épiques, ou de mise en ambiance.

Prix plus que raisonnable, il est en Alpha, mais il semblerait que l'aventure principale peut être déjà finis. Benjamin Ficus, l'un des dev', est particulièrement à l'écoute vis-à-vis de sa communauté, celle-ci participe à l'essor du jeu via des idées, des impressions, des corrections de détails (des décors traversables), la traduction (jeu en anglais), un réel feedback que l'on ne retrouve pas chez certains jeux en Alpha.

Si le jeu atteint le même potentiel que le tout premier, vous en aurez pour votre argent et votre temps : les quêtes annexes du premier étaient presque aussi longues que la quête principale.

Now, praise the Spaghetti Monster.

17466094.review:
Yah, their grammar isn't always great and.....well that's really the only negative I could give the game. And even still it's not always a negative as some of the dialouge is equally hilarious for it's grammar errors.

Doom and Destiny the first was an outstanding throwback to the classic top down rpg with, what I thought, great system for character development and a simply entertaining plot. The oppurtunity to get back into Doom and Destiny with a new installment is simply awesome.

It's an early access game so obviously a ways to go to the finished product but heres my list:

Pros:
- Cross platform saves: Love being able to go from my laptop to my phone seamlessly
- Neat class system
- Same comedic element I enjoyed in the first Do&De (though needs some help in the grammar/spelling department still)
- Arena feature is a nice change from the conventional method of grinding levels, though I seemed to power through leveling a little too fast

Cons:
- Multiplayer arena duels have a ways to go I think. Right now, you are only fighting AI controlled replica's of other players parties. Given the wide range of diversity in group builds the class system allows, would look forward to live battles with other players
- Early access so a little short on the play time but impressively diverse world and content so far

Based on my experience playing the first Do&De, I expect this will turn out to be a great second installment in the series!

16513419.review:
With the blessings of the Flying Spaghetti Monster, Nigel, Francis, Johny and Mike are back, and with a new rules set! Doom & Destiny: Advanced looks to raise the bar and add another insane adventure for you to feast upon. With all new features including classes, revamped abilities, cross platform play, and more! At the heart of the game though, what matters most is the humor and joyous spirit that was so perfectly captured in the first game. Does Do&De2 capture that? I believe so, with the theme being multi-dimensional versions of our main heroes. From the combat system to item management, everything has been streamlined for ease of use and getting to the fun and adventure. The game still does feature quite a bit of customization; stats, classes, and even appearance are yours to tinker with and change. Making a version of the party that is truly unique to your play style is one of the key focuses of Do&De2. The best part is that there is more to come, with new features being cooked up and added all the time. There is still some bumps on the road mind you, some grammar fixes, lack of start up menu, repetitive music. None of the former really stop the game from being an enjoyable experience. So gather your swords, staffs, and spatulas? 
Damn Francis. 
Ahem... Its time to kick ass and get some sweet loot in Doom & Destiny: Advanced

I made a video preview to show off some of the features and gameplay of this game!
https://youtu.be/dpsfvFf1fEg
I hope you enjoy!
Martyr

16402827.review:
Doom and Destiny Advanced is a kind of sequel to Doom and Destiny: Spaghetti Fantasy RPG. Never having played the first Doom and Destiny I couldn't tell you what the similarities are. What I can tell you are my first impressions.

https://youtu.be/Bi7QI6U4OAk

You and a group of your friends awaken in a burning castle. As you try to escape you are then teleported back to the real world where you are heading to play Do&De (essentially Dungeons and Dragons).

What this game does well is the humor. From the characters dialogue to the enemies you face there's constantly little things to have a good chuckle. For instance one of the first enemies you face is a giant poop monsters. I mean come on, how stupid is that (It's delightfully stupid that's how much).

The beginning of the game does a good job of taking you through a tutorial without making you feel like that's what it is. Woven into the first parts of the game are npc you can interact with that tell you what different things do. It's an effective way to get you started.

The rpg parts are typical of a top down rpg. You cast spells, level up, heal up and murder bitches. What really sets this game apart is the humor and charm. The story seems deep and enjoyable. Not without it's faults I've seen others report bugs, I personally didn't run into any. It is an early access game so I'm sure there are plenty of bugs. Even their updates point to bug fixes.

For more Indie Game, Movie and Music Reviews and Indie Game Podcast - EarlyAccessMedia.com, EarlyAccessPodcast.com and YouTube.com/EarlyAccessPodcast

16256396.review:
Remember: Early Access! Bugs everywhere and it's to be expected.

I played the first game to completion and loved every bit of it dearly, from the humor to the battles, the personality of each character, the easter eggs, pop culture references, and the awesome devs. All those are back in this 2nd game. I've been having a blast with my band of nerdy bros so far and can't wait for the game to be finished.

Do&DeAdv is more of a parallel universe than a sequel to the original. Many things will be familiar to those who played the first but it's an entirely different story. 17 hours including thorough exploration for secrets, puzzle solving, moderate exp grinding, unlocking and upgrading classes, online matchmaking, party optimisation for online battles, game bug hunting (to help flesh out the game) and I'm just past the half way mark through the game. There is a lot going for Do&DeAdv, though the english translation needs a lot of improvement (it's made by a group of Italians). I'm very forgiving when it comes to this but it may be enough to give others fluent in English a headache every now and then.

The devs are quite active in the community and are gladly and willingly accepting feedback and suggestions, as they were with the first game for years.

Should you get it? As with every Early Access, not everything is in the game yet and there's a lot of polishing that needs to be done. The main story is complete and every essential location is accessible. A couple of classes still need to be implemented as well as various locations and features such as New Game+, Steam cards/achievements. I recommend getting it now if you loved the first and are willing to spend time helping to build the game to its completion. Otherwise, follow the game and put it in your wishlist or buy it now and support the awesome devs!

16250545.review:
Do&De Advanced hands down is the best Indie game, aka Italian-Mary-Popin-Never-Regret-Soda-Role-Playing game, currently available in the market. It's a must for every oldschool RPGs fan, not a very must for everyone. But believe me, you will get good laughs out of it.

Just like Do&De, Advanced is crazy fun. It now has more features than the previous one, which indeed is a new breath to the game. Classes become important as you can switch between them for more strategies, they might be a thing when it comes to PvP as well. Yes! You heard me right. 

All in all, the game is unique and most of its parts are original. Need me to say more? Just start playing it then! Haha. ;)

16181260.review:
Игру ждали давно и очень долго. Еще с Октября 2014 года велся разговор о бете, а в Ноябре все надеялись к концу года погрузиться с головой в этот замечательный проект, но увы... 
И вот, наконец, удалось заполучить игру и мне, разработчику викиа. 

Запустив ее впервые я сильно удивился и даже немного испугался. Игра потребовала загрузить дополнительный контент с сети, как это бывает с приложениями для мобильных устройств после установки клиента. 

Дальше - интереснее. После интуитивно-простого обучения нас сразу внедряют в развивающийся динамичный сюжет. Игроки побывают в знакомых местах, вспомнят о некоторых персонажах, но нельзя забывать, что это совсем другая история. 

Самым неожиданным стала новая система сохранений и инвентарь. Привычная система боевки почти не изменилась, став лишь визуально-приятнее и понятнее новичкам. 
Мощи Героев претерпели большие изменения, появились классы и артифакты, вместе с которыми можно использовать мощи вещей, но обо всем попорядку. 

Новые мощи, классы, сюжет. Это все обрушивается бурлящим потоком воды, уносящим игрока далеко в фантастический мир Doom & Destiny: Advanced, тем не менее не давая утонуть и своими подсказками поддерживая его на плаву. 
Игра затягивает и заставляет невольно желать играть в нее снова и снова, даже на этапе Раннего Доступа. Интересно, чего добавят, чего уберут... 

Игра очень понравится бывалым, кто играл в первую часть и очень ждал вторую. Новички же с легкостью вольются в удивительный мир D&D и наверняка захотят пройти и первую часть. 
Я же постараюсь помочь и тем и другим, описывая мир [url=http://ru.doomanddestiny.wikia.com/wiki/Doom_and_Destiny_вики]DoAndDe на вики-проекте[/url] и описывая все новости в нашей [url=http://vk.com/doomanddestiny]группе ВКонтакте[/url].

16180491.review:
Поиграв совсем немного я увидел то, что хотел. Именно такой я и видел вторую часть ахренительной первой игры. Сюжет остался практически тот же самый: гики решают собраться вечерком и поиграть в настольную рпг игру у своего друга Бенджемина, или как они его величают - Игровой Мастер (на самом деле это сам разработчик). Но начинается писец, ибо всё вокруг начинает перевоплощаться в подземелья, туннели с лавой и другие весьма неординарные для обычного подвала места. В этом и заключается завязка сюжета и она даёт толчок дальнейшему абсурду, чёрному юмору и отсылкам. Чего стоит Халк Хоганн встречающий одного из героев xD
[b]Плюсы:[/b]
+ Отличный юмор. Мне действительно нравятся как разработчики подошли к нему. В сравнении с первой частью, как мне показалось шуток стало больше и они стали... смешнее что ли? Множество отссылок вкупе с сарказмом и самоиронией создают удивительную атмосферу.
+ Открытый и большой мир. Игра затянет вас не только юмором, но и большим обилием сайдквестов, пасхалок (а искать их одно удовольствие) и разнообразных мест.
+ Боевая система. Перед нами классическая jrpg игра, а значит отличные пошаговые бои вам обеспечены.
+ Классы. Каждый персонаж может брать по одному из классов доступных для него (на каждого их по четыре). Итого 16 классов, выбирай не хочу.
+ Графическая составляющая. По сравнению с первой частью разработчики очень сильно подтянули графику так как рисовали её сами, а не использовали стандартную из рпг мейкера.
+ Интерфейс. Всё плавненько и достаточно интуитивно. Можно настроить по своему вкусу.
[b]Минусы:[/b]
- Система прокачки персонажей. Как по мне, так она достаточно стандартная и убогая. 9-10 параметров и распределение очков каждый лвл ап. Скорее это моя личная непривязнь к ней.
- Как скажите мне такая простенькая на первый взгляд игра МОЖЕТ ПОДЛАГИВАТЬ КАЖДЫЕ 15 СЕКУНД С 16ГБ ОПЕРАТИВЫ И ВИДЕОКАРТОЙ НА 2ГБ. Самописный движок не идеален, надеюсь к релизу всё оптимизируют.
По минусам скорее придирки, а так игра мастхэв для любителей старых и хороших jrpg.
9.5/10
